definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: It sends a bad message to kids.
It proves him unspoilt by his uncle.
sentences.chinese: 这表明他没有被他叔叔教坏。

sentences.english: That’s all over, because I don’t want to teach bad things here.
sentences.chinese: 这方面就说这么多，因为我不想教坏。

sentences.english: But one author has written an entire book on how she believes the fairytale fantasies send a dangerous message.
sentences.chinese: 但有作家写了本书，认为童话故事会教坏小朋友。

sentences.english: I fear he will miseducate my son.
sentences.chinese: 我担心他会教坏我儿子。

sentences.english: Don't say these in the future. These concepts would teach people to be evil.
sentences.chinese: 以后再也不要这么说，那会教坏人心的。

definition: to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
to mess around/to mess with something/to have an affair
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
(of a lazy or incompetent teacher) to hamper students' progress/(of media) to propagate errors/to lead people astray
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
